result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:44 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant James J. Hohman in court with Attorney Scott S. Schlough. Attorney Schlough states they are waiting on blood/drug panel to come back. Requests return date a few months out.
Hearing scheduled for February 9, 2023 at 09:30 am.

9:43am Defendant James J. Hohman in court.  Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court for James J. Hohman.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:26 AM Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James J. Hohman in court.  Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court for James J. Hohman. Parties are waiting on blood test results.
Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 10:12 AM. 
Defendant James J. Hohman appeared in court with Attorney Scott Schlough. Attorney Robert Stoiber appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 6/13/22 at 3:00 PM.
RTN: 7/7/22 at 9:30 AM.

11:23 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James J. Hohman in court without counsel. 
Defendant advises he may be represented by Attorney Schlough. Waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 5-9-22 at 1:45 PM. Return to court 5-26-22 at 9:30 AM.
